page.title: 06LEISURE
page.content: {LEISURE} Smalley village may be small but there are quite alot of things for the residents to do during leisure time. For the children there are scout and cub groups. If you are interested in drawing there is an art group, or you could watch Stainsby Cricket Club and Smalley Villa football club if you are a sports fanatic. For the older generation there is a bingo club which runs every week. On Sundays there are Sunday schools for the children and two recreation grounds for the under eighteens and the under fifteens. There are two public houses where you could go every night. There is a card playing club which also runs every week. The Bell Inn is owned by a man called John Frederic Simms, it has a car park, and a beer garden. The other public house is the Nags Head.
